website_summaries.verdict: Aside from some sizing inconsistencies that are common in many ballet shoes, this pair by Blochs is well made and stylish.
pros: These are comfortable thanks to the flexible canvas construction and split-sole design
Slip-on style is easy to wear, and elastic straps keep them secure while dancing
Made by a popular name in ballet shoes
cons: Sizes are inconsistent with those on Bloch's sizing chart and tend to run quite small
Dancers with wide feet may need to order up as much as two sizes

customer_reviews.title: Professional dancers humble opinion...
customer_reviews.text: As much as I want to love these shoes, I have two major complaints with them. One is that they are SO narrow. The second is that they SLIDE OFF MY HEEL! I'm unable to execute any multiple turns, large grand jetés, etc. without them sliding off. I had wanted to get some shoes that didn't bunch up when the drawstring was pulled. The fit length wise is perfect though, so I'm sure it isn't a sizing issue. And though I have decently arched feet for a dancer, I really don't think these flatter your arches at all. I will have to save them for teaching class.
customer_reviews.author: Beauty 101

customer_reviews.title: Opted for Bloch Pro Elastic
customer_reviews.text: I’m new to ballet slippers so I ordered both the Bloch Synchrony and Bloch Pro Elastic. Same size, 7, for my street size 9 feet. What’s weird is that it’s the same Bloch sizing but the Synchrony sizing was so much smaller. The heel part didn’t cover my entire heel almost felt like it was going to slip off bc it was so low. Plus as seen in pics the leather sole didn’t match up to my heels. I took the same photos for both Pro Elastic and Synchrony and I’ll post the first ones under a review for Pro Elastic. Just odd that the same size would have so much variation between two styles from the same company.
customer_reviews.author: cp

customer_reviews.title: which I also love! I use this for my yoga workout to ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Bloch dance shoes...I also have the Pro Elastic, which I also love! I use this for my yoga workout to give me more support for plantar fasciitis. I ordered 2 sizes smaller than my street shoe size. I wear a women's size 10 street shoe and I ordered the 8C (Amazon size 8C/D) They are form fitting yet very comfy...almost like barefoot with more support! I am very happy with my purchase and received terrific customer service ordering from Online Dancewear through Amazon! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Hawaiian Queen

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly show the shape of the foot
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are excellent. They have a split sole. Shoes with a full sole hide your arch. With those shoes you will be trying throughout class to make your arch look better! I remember my teacher telling me over and over to point my toes! This split sole shoe allows the full curve of the foot to be seen. Soft genuine leather makes pirouttes smoother and easier. Elastic keeps shoes on firmly. Definitely get these!
customer_reviews.author: AMA

customer_reviews.title: and it fit perfectly with a tiny bit of room to grow. Not in a weird way where you can tell it's too big.
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly like in the specialty dance store but about 1/3 of the price. The sizes run small exactly as they do in the store. I ordered a 5B for a normal size 9-year-old that wears a size 3 or 3 1/2 in street shoe and it fit perfectly with a tiny bit of room to grow. Not in a weird way where you can tell it's too big.
customer_reviews.author: Oh_ChasquidoTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: happy feet
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my daughter who has danced ballet for years. This is the first time we've gotten canvas flats, usually we get leather. We knew to size down. She's normally a 7.5 street shoe and she sized down to a 5c for these ballet flats. The fit is great, no gaps on the side and they are comfortable. I have no idea how long they'll last, (we usually go through leather in about 8 months) but the price was fair, especially with the quick free shipping (prime). My daughter is thrilled with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Really like these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Really like these shoes. But they're too small. Normally when I follow Bloch's size chart, I have no issue. However, these shoes feel as if they're 1-1.5 sizes too small. For shoes that fit snugly like ballet shoes, that's too small. I like the pre-sewn elastics and that there's no string or binding around the shoe. But i will not order these again because apparently they don't come in a size big enough for me (Ladies size 10.5).
customer_reviews.author: KatieP27

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous (for me!)
customer_reviews.text: I was originally fitted with full sole Blochs (I must admit that being fitted at a dancewear store really helps ensure sizing - that's really the only way I knew how to find my size) but during every class I would be more worried about my shoes that what I was doing. These have ensured that I can focus more on the dance than how the shoes fit my feet =). These are /wonderful/. Inevitable disclaimer: shoes are incredibly personal, one of my good friends really wanted to like these but they just don't​ work for her. To each their own =)
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Don't believe it...
customer_reviews.text: So many reviews said "dance shoes are sized 2 sizes smaller"... Well, That obviously is not true for these!!! These are true to Your Regular size!!!! I wear 9 1/2, bought 7 1/2, Returned because far too small, like 2 sizes too small... I went up a size, thinking still "dance shoes are sized different".... Nope, still too small to wear..... Buy your regular size.
customer_reviews.author: CCook

customer_reviews.title: It shouldn't be this hard to buy ballet shoes! ...
customer_reviews.text: It shouldn't be this hard to buy ballet shoes! I read the Amazon directions to buy 1.5 sizes down, but the reviews sometimes said otherwise. I bought size 3.5 for my daughter, who is a street size 2.5. They were too small! So, I bought the 4...even smaller than the 3.5! The ballet shoe looks to be outstanding quality. It's a shame the sizing is inconsistent and inaccurate!
customer_reviews.author: momofthree

customer_reviews.title: Bloch Dance Women's Synchrony Split Sole Stretch Canvas Ballet Slipper/Shoe, Pink, 6.5 Narrow
customer_reviews.text: Long time dancer wearing size 6-6.5 women's street shoe. Ordered Bloch Dance Women's Synchrony Split Sole Stretch Canvas Ballet Slipper/Shoe, Pink, 6.5 Narrow in these shoes and they were a bit loose. Depending on how you like the fit, it can be good. I like them more snug so next time I'll have to order a smaller size. Love the quality! Still happy but these may run a little bigger so check with others also!
customer_reviews.author: JohnB21

customer_reviews.title: Like the stretch
customer_reviews.text: This fit much better than other ballet shoes I had ordered on Amazon. I like the canvas stretch. The only reason I did not give it five stars is after a ballet workout I have to refit it on my foot as it gets a little off center, but I do like it better than others I have tried.
customer_reviews.author: Fitness Lady

customer_reviews.title: TOO SMALL
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is incredibly tiny. So small that my 7yo didn’t even tried. We bought her a size 2 for women as she usually wear size 1,5 in her street shoes and 2 for flip flops but, as you will see in the pictures, there is no way this is a size 2 for women. She fit the Bloch Pro Elastic 2 -for women too- right now that is visibily bigger even if the size is the same. (There is a picture with the Pro Elastic on)
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes (see details for sizing)
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful ballet slippers that provide high support for the arch. They are extremely high-quality and I definitely would recommend them! I purchased these for a 12 y.o girl who has size 36 European. I bought the size 6 and they fit! They were slightly big but she was still able to wear them. They were perfect! Lastly, the color was really nice and perfect for a classic ballet class. 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Sophie

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Snug Fit
customer_reviews.text: I really like these. They are comfortable and fit my feet with a comfortable snug fit. I wear a size 10 street shoe, however I ordered these in a size 7.5 and they are the perfect fit. The pricing is right and they are made very well. I'll order more and have told my classmates about these.
customer_reviews.author: Weatherproof

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for narrow feet
customer_reviews.text: Upon initial trial I thought they fit & they are the same size I purchased in the non-elastic fabric, however I struggled through a short ballet class because they are not adjustable. They will not stay on my narrow heels & fit a little wide with extra room in the toe box. The color was much darker than expected, but fine. Not recommended for narrow feet!
customer_reviews.author: Becx

customer_reviews.title: I prefer leather dance shoes
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 6.5 to 7 in street shoes. These shoes in 6.5 fit me perfectly. However, I find the fit very uncomfortable. The canvas is stretchy and thick. I always feel like my toes are being compressed too much, although the shoes really are not too tight. I vastly prefer leather dance shoes, which I can stretch and break-in to fit my feet perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Green Mom

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable and very flexible
customer_reviews.text: I am taking Gentle Ballet for older women/men and started out wearing the typical leather ballet slippers. I noticed that a lot of the people in the class, including the teacher, were wearing the fabric shoes so I gave them a try. They are so comfortable and flexible and I feel as if my feet are happier. It is easier to point and I like the way they look. Great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Lsap

customer_reviews.title: No complaints. Exactly what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I did my research and continually read these run small. I normally fit a 6.5 or 7 in most shoes. So I tried a 5.5 in these. Fits perfectly. Very snug, but as I wear them I know they will stretch a bit to my foot. I'm using them at home only for working out with yoga and ballet. Exactly what I wanted. :)
customer_reviews.author: Harmony Jane

customer_reviews.title: Moves on my foot
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is great, but I wish I had purchased the one that isn't made of stretchy canvas. It tends to slip and slide all over my feet, especially when my feet begin sweating. The Bloch shoes that are similar to this but made of regular canvas rather than stretchy canvas are much more form-fitting when we really begin moving. I would purchase the non-stretchy shoes in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Brown Wahine

customer_reviews.title: Know your size, quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Great product in general, just know your size and what you’re ordering! I ordered the standard 7 assuming it was a B width, but the regular size 7 arrived as 7C (wide). In the future I will choose 7 Narrow (which should be a B width), but these do work for practice, which is what I needed them for. Also, the inner bag that contained the shoes were clearly ripped when I opened the box, so they were possibly tried on by someone else before they arrived to me, but the shoes were fully intact. They’ve been working great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Herrick

customer_reviews.title: People can actually dance in these?
customer_reviews.text: I know my Bloch size as I've been wearing the brand since 1989. But, this style is cut so low on the heel, there was no way I was trusting them to stay on. They make your foot look lovely - which would be great if you didn't actually have to do anything in them! Returned and went with the Performa style.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Fernandes

customer_reviews.title: fit perfect. Very flexible and your feet doesnt get stuck ...
customer_reviews.text: True to size. I'm mostly 8, so brought an 8, fit perfect. Very flexible and your feet doesnt get stuck in the turn. If you havent use a ballet sleapers before, dont try any other, just this one.
customer_reviews.author: Noemi Amador

customer_reviews.title: Runs VERY small
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wears a size 1.5 kids sizes for running and dressy shows. I bought a women's size 2 in these and they are VERY small on her. The heel of the shoe fits closer to the middle of the foot, then where it should fit. Judging by the way these fit, she would need a size Women 3, and she truly has small skinny feet.
customer_reviews.author: Cloe J

customer_reviews.title: A good practice shoe
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wears a 6 or 7 in street shoes, and the 6.5 in this ballet shoe fits perfectly. She likes the straps crossing on top of her foot better than her previous pair with just one straight strap. She also likes that they don't have a drawstring. I don't think the fabric looks as nice as leather, but she says it's more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrie L. Henry

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 7 medium width in dress shoes and I ordered size 5 C. The fit is just right and the quality is exceptional for the price. I highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Gingercanbark

customer_reviews.title: Urg - too small for me, I wear a women's 10
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 10-10.5 women's shoe depending on the cut. I purchased an 8 and I wish there was an 8.5 in this particular design. They feel like they are slipping off the back even though they are not, and my bog toes are trying to pop through. I love the construction, but wish there was an all vegan option. These seems super sturdy, especially with how the cross straps are sewn in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Split soles, soft leather. Girls in class were envious
customer_reviews.author: denise

customer_reviews.title: These shoes seem sturdy but unfortunately I returned both pairs I bought
customer_reviews.text: These shoes seem sturdy but unfortunately I returned both pairs I bought. The canvas material is extremely thick and I did not have the mobility I'd want for proper foot articulation. I love this brand for character shoes but maybe these are better for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Kim K

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered this in a size that was too small, and was able to exchange it for free. fits very well, i like that it comes pre-sewn and doesn't have the elastic that needs to be tied. my feet are a size 6 and i ordered a size 5 in this shoe. i could have probable gone with a 5.5 though.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Great looking slippers
customer_reviews.text: Just received these for my 10 yr old daughter. She wears a 5 kids/ 7 womans sneaker and I ordered her a 41/2c as others reviewers said to order 2 sizes down. Her feet are semi wide so I went with 1.5 sizes down instead. She hasn’t danced in them yet, but the look and feel are great! They are snug fitting and make her feet look awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Aimee Hennigar

customer_reviews.title: Fit true to size and give the foot a beautiful aesthetic
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable and supportive soft ballet shoes I’ve ever worn in over 20yrs of training and teaching ballet. I was worried when I first tried them on that they were too small but they actually fit perfectly. I also really like the aesthetic that they give my foot and that I didn’t have to sew on my own elastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Originally loved the width through the toes for foot articulation
customer_reviews.text: I have a wide toe box and narrow heel. Originally loved the width through the toes for foot articulation, but over the course of class the heel became loose and I "swam" in themin center. Would probably be mitigated by a drawstring. Trying the zenith next, but I really loved the way this feels at barre.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My teenaged daughter wears these and she says they are more comfortable than a leather ballet shoe
customer_reviews.text: Sizing is off but that could be just because that's the way it seems to be when buying ballet flats. My teenaged daughter wears these and she says they are more comfortable than a leather ballet shoe. This is her first canvas pair. We like Bloch shoes because my daughter has a wide foot and Bloch seems to run wider than the other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Mamma

customer_reviews.title: Know your measurements. Don’t go by street shoe size
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good brand and quality product. The material in all of their products are always quality and the shoes are durable. They run small, so be sure to have the foot measurements.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Heindl

customer_reviews.title: Fits great and price is good
customer_reviews.text: My daughter got these for dance and they fit great’ price is good and would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: julie moser

customer_reviews.title: Weirdly bunched up fabric.
customer_reviews.text: The fabric is bunched up in very weird places, and the soles never stayed centered on my foot despite the shoe fitting perfectly in all other areas. It constantly slid sideways so that the ball of my foot would be half resting on the sole and half on the canvas body of the shoe. Very uncomfortable to dance in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BALLET SHOES!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got size 4.5. My shoe size is 23.5cm, and US size 6 or 6.5. The ballet shoes fit perfectly, and it supports my arch very well. I would say it is the best ballet shoes I have ever worn. I just wear it bare foot, but if you wear tights and/or socks inside the shoes, I recommend to half size up.
customer_reviews.author: Pink Bunny

customer_reviews.title: Order 2-1/2 sizes smaller rhan street shoe. Don’t wear with overhang in heel.
customer_reviews.text: Need correct fit for ballet class. Bought and returned four pairs. First three too large, fourth suppused to fit but what arrived was different shoe and seemed a size and half smaller ( just ordered half size smaller).
customer_reviews.author: joan pfeffer

customer_reviews.title: Tight. Small. Butnso pretty.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are supportive, but run small. Canvas is super stretchy and crunched my toes together when I picked up my foot. Heel kept slipping down as well. Beautiful shoe. I'm sad to have to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Patti R. Azzara

customer_reviews.title: Ordered street size for girl’s shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are great ballet shoes! I ordered several sizes for my 8 year old daughter. Her foot is 8 1/4 inches and the 3 fit her with just a bit of room to grow. The 2 was too small to get on. She wears a 2.5 or 3 street shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Nice ballet shoes without the strings
customer_reviews.text: This is my daughter's first pair of ballet shoes in adult size. We love it that she doesn't have to fidget with any string. We got size 3. Her street shoes size is 1.5. They do fit well on her with a little toe room to grow.
customer_reviews.author: Amz customer

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these ballet shoes for my daughter, they fit well and work very nice, except the bottom padding do run up your feet just a little bit and provide a small discomfort for long wear, So i would recommend getting half a side up, but overall the shoes were very nice and would definitely purchase again
customer_reviews.author: VS

customer_reviews.title: True
customer_reviews.text: True to size for 9 year old with big feet
customer_reviews.author: katie holm

customer_reviews.title: Best Fit Ever for me
customer_reviews.text: Best fit of any slippers I've ever had! I didn't have to take them in or alter these at all. They fit perfectly straight from the box. Ordering them via Amazon meant I could get the specific size I needed and not what sizes the dance stores may stock. Thinking of ordering another pair to have on hand for after I wear this pair out.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Noble

customer_reviews.title: Attractively shapes the foot but runs too small.
customer_reviews.text: If you can find your size it shapes the foot nicely but runs small. I had to give mine away.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Tipper

customer_reviews.title: Sizing Chart is Off :/ Size Up Ladies!!!
customer_reviews.text: The sizing chart was so confusing to me (maybe I'm just an idiot). I wear in 8.5 in women's shoes, so I chose a 6B because the sizing chart had the equivalent as a 6B as 8.5-9 shoe. The ballet slipper itself is nice enough though. I'll be returning these just get a regular old 8.5 shoe size.
customer_reviews.author: shalonda sanders

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for comfortable and fit ballet flat, and was very disappointed until I found Bloch flat. Love it and definitely will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Conejo Dancer

customer_reviews.title: Good narrow fit for my daughters skinny feet
customer_reviews.text: Good narrow fit for my daughters skinny feet, but I had to send back for a full size up. She wears a women's 6 to 6.5. We ordered a 4.5 and her toes were pushing on the end of the shoe. Still waiting on the 5.5 to arrive.
customer_reviews.author: Chaos Momma

customer_reviews.title: Fit is perfect
customer_reviews.text: They fit true to size I wear a 8.5 to 9 in womens so the 6.5 to 7 are a perfect fit. I wont be buying my ballet shoes anywhere else!
customer_reviews.author: Herbert Horn

customer_reviews.title: I followed the sizing recommendation and they fit great.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these for my daughter that is away at college. I followed the sizing recommendation and they fit great.
customer_reviews.author: kleiweke

customer_reviews.title: Good design
customer_reviews.text: Good fit. Hugs the foot nicely for clear articulation. The elastic around the top is a nice touch
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Love them and came quicker than ordering for Bloch website!
customer_reviews.author: noelle dumont

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I have regular width feet (not narrow, not wide) and my street shoe size fit perfectly! These shoes are great! Comfortable and fit perfectly to the contours of your feet to better see placement.
customer_reviews.author: Momma Bear

customer_reviews.title: Way too small, order up.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the recommended size based on my street shoe. Should have gone up two sizes from what they recommend, they fit an 8 year old. Way too small.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Too small!
customer_reviews.text: The bloch synchrony canvas runs small compared to other types of bloch shoes. The material is uncomfortable for me. This type of canvas is not very soft. I recommend buying canvas shoes from so danca or other brand.
customer_reviews.author: amarilis

customer_reviews.title: Order a size and half to 2 sizes down!
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a size 7 - 7.5 women shoe. I also have wide feet with a high foot profile. I ordered in 5.5 C and it fits perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: KatCreates

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: I had to return two pairs to get the right fit, but now they fit perfectly and form well to my feet. I love the way they fit and look. I’m a US women’s street shoe size 9, my feet are average to narrow width; I ended up with a size 7.5B in this ballet shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Opened them and they are dirty and used.
customer_reviews.text: Just opened the box and the bottoms of those slippers are filthy. They are dirty and worn down, very obviously used. This is awful. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Julie K.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful shoe! This shoe ran about 1 size small ...
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful shoe! This shoe ran about 1 size small for me; I have wide feet, a high arch and long toes. The elastic around the shoe opening is fantastic, but the pre sewn elastic is a tad tight.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Fit as expected.
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old daughter loves them. She wears a/youth size 4 in regular shoes, a youth size 3.5 in converse, and has very skinny/ narrow feet, the size 4 in these fit her perfectly. She wears a size 6 in capezio brand for reference.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher C.

customer_reviews.title: so the size 5 which should have been rather tight as I like, turned out to be like a half size ...
customer_reviews.text: The US sizes are different from the UK sizes I had used before, so the size 5 which should have been rather tight as I like, turned out to be like a half size larger.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia A.

customer_reviews.title: My daughter says this fits like a glove and feels natural on her foot
customer_reviews.text: My daughter says this fits like a glove and feels natural on her foot. She has a good point and turn with it on. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Cindi Washington

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, lovely shoe!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wears a 7.5-8 women's shoe and the 6.5 fit perfectly with just a bit of room to grow. Snug to her narrow foot, and elastics are perfectly positioned (no sewing- yay!). The color is a tad darker than traditional ballet pink but not enough to be an issue. Will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: jillian

customer_reviews.title: Affordable price and a great quality !
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and a great price! My daughter loves them - will buy again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Mila

customer_reviews.title: Really good shoes, they have lasted about 6 months and ...
customer_reviews.text: Really good shoes , they have lasted about 6 months and wife is still using them
customer_reviews.author: The Williams family

customer_reviews.title: Wrong product
customer_reviews.text: They sent a black Croc looking shoe instead of a ballet shoes. These are needed for a play and this was not even close to what I ordered.
customer_reviews.author: monique

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: bought these for my daughter and she loves them! Remains to be seen how durable they will be! I sprayed them with a fabric protector as I do with all shoes, so will see how they hold up!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love them - they are snug, conform to my feet and all their bumps.
customer_reviews.author: JoanieCollinsVillaverde

customer_reviews.title: Well-made and they last!
customer_reviews.text: These ballet flats are well-made and sturdy. They lasted 1.5 years of dance class 2x week.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy H

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY DISATISFIED
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this product, because it was too tight, and hard to stretch. My daughter only wore them once, and refused to wear them again. It was not what was shown on the item image.
customer_reviews.author: Darcie ramirez

customer_reviews.title: ... a 7B (med width) in these and they fit perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 9 street shoe and got a 7B (med width) in these and they fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Heather S

customer_reviews.title: These appear to be good quality split sole ballet flats
customer_reviews.text: These appear to be good quality split sole ballet flats. I ordered them to replace a pair my daughter had grown out of, so I ordered them a full size larger than her existing pair in a different brand. Unfortunately, they're just as small, if not smaller, than the pair I meant to replace.
customer_reviews.author: newyorkdruid

customer_reviews.title: Elegant and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I feel wonderful when I wear them. So comfortable and elegant.
customer_reviews.author: Reece

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: I am street 8 and I ordered 8, they fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Meow Han

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for weekly classes
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for what I needed. Regular width is narrower than expected so if you have a larger size foot I’d suggest going with wide for comfort purposes
customer_reviews.author: i love it

customer_reviews.title: Sizing
customer_reviews.text: If you wear a street size 9 get a 7 bloch fit
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Ann

customer_reviews.title: Love the design and it looks very nice on feet
customer_reviews.text: Love the design and it looks very nice on feet, but should order bigger size .. My street shoe size is 9.5, i ordered 8C as i didn't find bigger size on the amazon order size list ( at first i want to order size 8.5 D )
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 6.5 in street size and ordered a 5.5. I was surprised when it actually fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Tete7

customer_reviews.title: my favorite slippers EVER they fit perfectly
customer_reviews.text: my favorite slippers EVER they fit perfectly, I have narrow feet and a high arch and they make my arch so pretty and don't gap at all on the sides.
customer_reviews.author: zoradora

customer_reviews.title: Too small but such great product!
customer_reviews.text: They’re such a great product! And the only brand I buy from in ballet is Bloch but they were too small! And I had to take them back.
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: Good exercise shoe
customer_reviews.text: I’m using the product for Fit Barre class. It works fine. Would like the toe area to be a little roomier.
customer_reviews.author: Berta Adams

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I knew exactly what I wanted so these were perfect
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto Rojas

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves these and thinks she dances better in them. They are ver comfortable and I didn't have to sew the straps!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Jourdant

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love these ballet slippers ! they enhance the look of my rather flat arch
customer_reviews.author: gianna

customer_reviews.title: Size varies.
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are always well made. However, we had size 3, bought a 4, and they are smaller than the 3. Need to return.
customer_reviews.author: Chantelle

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the ballet slippers and they came quickly and fit perfectly. My granddaughter was delighted.
customer_reviews.author: Sandee Merrick

customer_reviews.title: Liked the quality; sized large compared to street shoe sizing.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a perfect size 8 in street shoes, and these size 8's were several sizes too large. Seemed like good quality shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer NK

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love my blochs that I've gotten in the past -- ...
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my blochs that I've gotten in the past -- especially becasue they have a much larger leather pad under my foot which is ideal for me. I have always ordered an 8B. But this pair was so odd. They pinched out around the middle of my foot when I went into elevé which made the slipper look awful on my foot -- which in turn made my feet look awful in elevé. my ballet slippers looked like little pink yodas on my feet! :) I gave them away. Disappointed. I will try another pair of blochs from discount dance this time.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie in Alaska

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.text: They have worked out very well for me. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: These are washable..
customer_reviews.text: My youngest daughter wears these for ballett class..loves loves loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey Dozier

customer_reviews.title: Run Small
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 8 years old and wears a street shoe 2.5. I purchased a size 3.5 and they fit good. They run small so I would recommend buying a full size bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Marie

customer_reviews.title: Lovely canvas ballet slippers--elastics pre-sewn and ideally placed. But ...
customer_reviews.text: Lovely canvas ballet slippers--elastics pre-sewn and ideally placed. But at least half a size smaller than indicated on size guide. Unwearable. Size up from Bloch size guide!
customer_reviews.author: Mariana T

customer_reviews.title: Give a lot of flexibility but good padding on ball and heel
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly what I wanted! Give a lot of flexibility but good padding on ball and heel. Most comfortable ballet shoes I have had.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe...beware of what size you ask for.
customer_reviews.text: I had to figure what size to ask for...and of all the advice..only one person got it right. My street size goes from 5 to 5 1/2 to 6....and i hit the jackpot and asked for a 4c..i have a wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: doris gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I like the product. And it’s been used for ballet
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Great quality shoe but sizing is off. Too small!
customer_reviews.text: The ballet shoes were beautiful, great quality material, however I sent them back due to sizing. I followed the sizing charts on their website with my daughter's measirements. According to the sizing, it said she should be a size 2.5 and that is what I ordered. She is a size 4 in regular shoes. When they came, she couldn't barely squeeze her foot in the ballet shoe. I'm sure if I would have ordered a size equal to her street shoe, they would have fit. My suggestion would be to order normal size.
customer_reviews.author: Aedr23

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old likes them and they are comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer K.

customer_reviews.title: Order a size smaller
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 6.5 in street shoes. For these ballet shoes, you have to order a size down. In my case, that was a size 5.5 C width. Fits just fine and I can dance in them.
customer_reviews.author: Jody E.

customer_reviews.title: comfortable..
customer_reviews.text: I like it fits the best for me. Easily Turn and balance.!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Bloch Dance Women's Synchrony Split Sole Stretch Canvas Ballet Slipper/Shoe
product_meta.description: Founded in Sydney, in 1932 by Jacob Bloch, Bloch is a pioneer in the technical dance market. Since its inception, the renowned footwear brand has produced handmade pointe shoes for esteemed ballet dancers worldwide. Bloch recently entered an exciting new period of innovation and fashion design with the creation of mainstream footwear, following the demands by current customers to create street-ready shoes.
feature_bullets: Innovative fibers within the canvas material stretch and recover always reflecting the natural shape of the foot
Sleek and streamline look on the foot
Soft, wide elastic at the top line as well as pre-sewn crossed elastic to ensure secure fit
Wider outsole design with no ridges to allow natural spreading of toes for easy balance and turning
Sizing: Start with 2 sizes down from normal street shoe size
Width Suggestions: B - Narrow C - Medium
